column1: Kata Robata////They did not have a drink menu per se. The waiter just told me that the bar could make whatever I wanted. He suggested their signature drink the lychee martini which was way too sweet
column2: all lychee and no vodka. The Hamachi & Jalapeno Sashimi would have been excellent with hints of sea salt
column3: fresh jalapeno and yuzu olive oil but they literally drowned it in the olive oil. In this case
column4: less is always better. The spicy tuna rolls were very average. I can think of two other places in town whose spicy tuna would rock the socks off of what I had at Kata Robata.
